A.title: Manifest V1 Schema
A.description: The manifest file contains all the basic information about the pack that Minecraft needs to identify it. The tables below contain all the components of the manifest, their individual properties, and what they mean.

format_version.description: This defines the current version of the manifest. Don't change this unless you have a good reason to
format_version.title: Format Version

name.description: This is the name of the pack as it appears within Minecraft.
name.title: Name

description.description: This is a short description of the pack. It will appear in the game below the name of the pack. We recommend keeping it to 1-2 lines.
description.title: Description

uuid.description: This is a special type of identifier that uniquely identifies this pack from any other pack. UUIDs are written in the format xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx where each x is a hexadecimal value (0-9 or a-f). We recommend using an online service to generate this and guarantee their uniqueness (just bing UUID Generator to find some)
uuid.title: UUID

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the version of your pack in the format [majorVersion, minorVersion, revision].

min_engine_version.description: This is the minimum version of the game that this pack was written for. This helps the game identify whether any backwards compatibility is needed for your pack. You should always use the highest version currently available when creating packs
min_engine_version.title: Minimum Engine Version

pack_scope.title: Pack Scope
pack_scope.description: This is the scope of the pack. This is only for resource packs

type.description: This is the type of the module. Can be any of the following: resources, data, client_data, interface, world_template
type.title: Type

description.description: This is a short description of the module. This is not user-facing at the moment but is a good place to remind yourself why the module is defined
description.title: Description

uuid.description: This is a unique identifier for the module in the same format as the pack's UUID in the header. This should be different from the pack's UUID, and different for every module
uuid.title: UUID

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the version of the module in the same format as the pack's version in the header. This can be used to further identify changes in your pack

dependencies.description: These are the different features that the pack makes use of that aren't necessarily enabled by default.

uuid.description: This is the unique identifier of the pack that this pack depends on. It needs to be the exact same UUID that the pack has defined in the header section of it's manifest file
uuid.title: UUID

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the specific version of the pack that your pack depends on. Should match the version the other pack has in its manifest file

dependencies.title: Dependencies

capabilities.title: Capabilities
capabilities.description: These are the different features that the pack makes use of that aren't necessarily enabled by default.

experimental_custom_ui.description: Allows HTML files in the pack to be used for custom UI, and scripts in the pack to call and manipulate custom UI.
experimental_custom_ui.title: Experimental Custom Ui

chemistry.description: Allows the pack to add, change or replace Chemistry functionality.
chemistry.title: Chemistry

authors.title: Authors
authors.description: Name of the author(s) of the pack.

items.title: Name
items.description: Name of the author of the pack.

url.description: The home website of your pack.
url.title: Url

product_type.title: Product Type
product_type.description: The type of product this pack is. This is used to determine how the pack is displayed in the store.

F.title: Format Version
F.description: A version that tells minecraft what type of data format can be expected when reading this file.

E.title: Manifest V2 Schema
E.description: The manifest file contains all the basic information about the pack that Minecraft needs to identify it. The tables below contain all the components of the manifest, their individual properties, and what they mean.

format_version.title: Format Version
format_version.description: This defines the current version of the manifest. Don't change this unless you have a good reason to

capabilities.title: Capabilities
capabilities.description: These are the different features that the pack makes use of that aren't necessarily enabled by default.

chemistry.description: Allows the pack to add, change or replace Chemistry functionality.
chemistry.title: Chemistry

editorExtension.description: Indicates that this pack contains extensions for editing.
editorExtension.title: Editor Extension

experimental_custom_ui.description: Allows HTML files in the pack to be used for custom UI, and scripts in the pack to call and manipulate custom UI.
experimental_custom_ui.title: Experimental Custom Ui

raytraced.description: Indicates that this pack contains Raytracing Enhanced or Physical Based Materials for rendering.
raytraced.title: Raytraced

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: Section containing definitions for any other packs or modules that are required in order for this manifest.json file to work.

oneOf.title: Dependency
oneOf.description: Section containing definitions for any other packs that are required in order for this manifest.json file to work.

uuid.description: This is the unique identifier of the pack that this pack depends on. It needs to be the exact same UUID that the pack has defined in the header section of it's manifest file
uuid.title: Uuid

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the specific version of the pack that your pack depends on. Should match the version the other pack has in its manifest file

oneOf.title: Dependency
oneOf.description: Section containing definitions for any other packs or modules that are required in order for this manifest.json file to work.

module_name.description: This is the name of the module that this pack depends on.
module_name.title: Module Name

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the specific version of the module that your pack depends on.

header.description: Section containing information regarding the name of the pack, description, and other features that are public facing.
header.title: Header

allow_random_seed.title: Allow Random Seed
allow_random_seed.description: This option is required for any world templates. This will allow the player to use a random seed when creating a new world from your template.

base_game_version.title: Base Game Version
base_game_version.description: This is the version of the base game your world template requires, specified as [majorVersion, minorVersion, revision]. We use this to determine what version of the base game resource and behavior packs to apply when your content is used.

description.title: Description
description.description: This is a short description of the pack. It will appear in the game below the name of the pack. We recommend keeping it to 1-2 lines.

lock_template_options.title: Lock Template Options
lock_template_options.description: This option is required for any world templates. This will lock the player from modifying the options of the world.

min_engine_version.title: Minimum Engine Version
min_engine_version.description: This is the minimum version of the game that this pack was written for. This is a required field for resource and behavior packs. This helps the game identify whether any backwards compatibility is needed for your pack. You should always use the highest version currently available when creating packs

name.title: Name
name.description: This is the name of the pack as it appears within Minecraft. This is a required field.

pack_scope.title: Pack Scope
pack_scope.description: This is the scope of the pack. This is only for resource packs

uuid.title: UUID
uuid.description: This is a special type of identifier that uniquely identifies this pack from any other pack. UUIDs are written in the format xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx where each x is a hexadecimal value (0-9 or a-f). We recommend using an online service to generate this and guarantee their uniqueness (just bing UUID Generator to find some)

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the version of your pack in the format [majorVersion, minorVersion, revision].

modules.title: Modules
modules.description: Section containing information regarding the type of content that is being brought in.

items.description: Section containing information regarding the type of content that is being brought in.
items.title: Module

description.description: This is a short description of the module. This is not user-facing at the moment but is a good place to remind yourself why the module is defined
description.title: Description

type.description: This is the type of the module.
type.title: Type

uuid.description: This is a unique identifier for the module in the same format as the pack's UUID in the header. This should be different from the pack's UUID, and different for every module
uuid.title: Uuid

version.title: Version
version.description: This is the version of your pack in the format [majorVersion, minorVersion, revision]. The version number is used when importing a pack that has been imported before. The new pack will replace the old one if the version is higher, and ignored if it's the same or lower

entry.title: Entry
entry.description: The javascript entry point for tests, only works if types has been set to `javascript`.

metadata.description: Section containing the metadata about the file such as authors and licensing information.
metadata.title: Metadata

authors.title: Authors
authors.description: Name of the author(s) of the pack.

items.title: Name
items.description: Name of the author of the pack.

generated_with.title: Generated With
generated_with.description: A list of tools and their version that have modified this pack.

additionalProperties.title: Tool
additionalProperties.description: The tool and the version used to modified this pack.

product_type.title: Product Type
product_type.description: The type of product this pack is. This is used to determine how the pack is displayed in the store.

url.title: Url
url.description: The home website of your pack.

subpacks.title: Subpacks
subpacks.description: A list of subpacks that are applied per memory tier.

items.description: A single definition of a subpack.
items.title: Subpacks

folder_name.description: This represents the folder name located in "subpacks" folder. When user select this resolution Minecraft loads the content inside the folder.
folder_name.title: Folder Name

name.description: This is the name of the pack resolution. This lets user know what resolution they are choosing.
name.title: Name

memory_tier.title: Memory Tier
memory_tier.description: This creates a requirement on the capacity of memory needed to select the resolution. Each tier increases memory requirement by 256 MB.
